reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome adventure for young kids
reviews.reviewText: My son who's 6 loves adventure movies and stories. Just finished reading this to him as a bed time story. He loved it and so did we. Easy to read. Easy to understand and follow for him. Just ordered number 2 and 3. Can't wait to read them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What a delight! A splendid adventure.
reviews.reviewText: The language, the pace and the level of intrigue of this children’s book are spot on for the target audience, 7 to 10-year-olds. The illustrations match the atmosphere of the text and I believe young children will be mesmerized. The author, G. S. McClellan, liberally weaves accurate cultural and geographical facts seamlessly into the storyline. This way young readers learn as they follow Joey and his new friend, Gustavo on a magical adventure that takes Joey from Vermont to Bolivia and home again.Well-written and full of beautifully visual descriptions, I am sure children will love this book even more than I did, if that is possible.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book takes readers on a thrilling journey with young Joey Jimmer-Jefferson as he unravels the mystery surrounding a magical mailbox and embarks on a mission to protect a priceless ancient artifact. With its blend of mystery, magic, and a courageous young protagonist, this book keeps readers on the edge of their seats, making it a must-read for fans of action-packed and imaginative tales. I highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A five star adventure awaits you and your young reader!
reviews.reviewText: A Five-Star Adventure! Join Joey Jimmer-Jefferson on an exhilarating journey to save a priceless ancient artifact from cunning thieves. Transported by a mysterious mailbox to South America's highest lake, Joey must unlock its secrets to return home. Packed with mystery, courage, and quick thinking, this thrilling fiction is a must-read for young adventurers!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My children and I loved this book. I read it with my two younger girls (10, 8), and they were hanging on my every word. The adventure is thrilling and fun, the illustrations are beautiful, and we loved that it featured Lake Titicaca. I have the Kindle version, but I might just buy the paperback too, especially to read with tutoring students. I highly recommend it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Reluctant Reader Enjoyed It!
reviews.reviewText: Thank goodness I found this book. My reluctant reader dislikes reading for his school assignments but would tolerate the G00sebumps books. No disrespect to Stine, but I kind of hate those. Magic Tree house seemed a tad too young for my kid and he showed zero interest. He read this book in just a few days and enjoyed it! I've bought the next two paperbacks in the series and just want to thank the author for a fun and creative story that my kid could enjoy. I'm an avid reader and an author myself, so I know the value of a positive review. Please keep writing these! It's difficult to find books for ten year old boys that aren't horror or comic-style. Bravo!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Thrilling and fun
reviews.reviewText: A thrilling and fun story, where young Joey Jimmer-Jefferson transforms into a hero through the enchanting powers of a magical mailbox, transporting him across space to aid another child in need. The narrative unfolds with an exhilarating pace, keeping young readers engaged with its adventurous twists and turns. Overall, it's a delightful and enjoyable read that captures the essence of courage, friendship, and the magic of unexpected journeys.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful for pre-teen
reviews.reviewText: This is a great adventure story for a pre-teen. The mailbox plot tool is great, although an explanation might of its origin would be nice. Still, a solid tale, which exposes children to other cultures.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I recently visited Lake Titicaca so this book was a no-brainer to buy. This was a great fantasy book with plenty of mystery. Would definitely recommend
